docs.lead_paragraph: Responses from doctors and a patient to the editorial “When the Doctor Is Not Needed.”

headline.main: Who Should Provide Our Medical Care?
headline.print_headline: Who Should Provide Our Medical Care?

docs.abstract: Letter from Ardis D Hoven, president-elect of American Medical Association, responds to December 16 editorial arguing that well-trained health care workers can do some jobs as well or better, and for much less money, than doctors.

docs.lead_paragraph: Annmarie Nicholson, who was struggling to find work after being laid off from her job on Wall Street, became trapped in her home by floodwaters from Hurricane Sandy.

headline.seo: After Losing Her Job in ’09, a Woman Is Derailed Again After Trying to Rebuild
headline.main: After Losing Job in ’09, Woman Is Impeded Again After Trying to Rebuild
headline.print_headline: After Losing Job in ’09, Woman Is Impeded Again After Trying to Rebuild

docs.abstract: UJA-Federation of New York helps Annmarie Nicholson pay her rent in a new home after her Staten Island apartment was destroyed by Hurricane Sandy, trapping her for 12 hours in floodwaters that rose up to her neck.
docs.snippet: Annmarie Nicholson, who was struggling to find work after being laid off from her job on Wall Street, became trapped in her home by floodwaters from Hurricane Sandy.

docs.lead_paragraph: A federal judge on Friday blocked a new state law requiring insurers to offer policies excluding birth control coverage because it conflicts with a federal law mandating such coverage.

headline.seo: Missouri: Judge Blocks New Law Preventing Birth Control Coverage
headline.main: Missouri: Judge Blocks New Law Preventing Birth Control Coverage
headline.print_headline: Missouri: Judge Blocks New Law Preventing Birth Control Coverage

docs.abstract: Judge Audry G Fleissig of Federal District Court issues temporary restraining order against Missouri law requiring insurers to offer policies excluding birth control coverage, saying it conflicts with a federal law mandating such coverage.
docs.snippet: A federal judge on Friday blocked a new state law requiring insurers to offer policies excluding birth control coverage because it conflicts with a federal law mandating such coverage.

headline.seo: Medicare’s Chief Actuary, Richard Foster, Retiring
headline.main: Medicare’s Influential Chief Actuary to Retire
headline.print_headline: Medicare’s Influential Chief Actuary to Retire

docs.abstract: Richard S Foster, who as chief actuary of Medicare program for last 18 years has nettled presidents of both parties with his projections of rapid growth in federal health care spending, announces plan to retire in January 2013.

docs.lead_paragraph: While many people with health insurance also have mental health coverage, some are reluctant to use it — or can’t find a practitioner who will accept it.

headline.seo: Walking the Tightrope on Mental Health Coverage
headline.main: Walking the Tightrope on Mental Health Coverage
headline.print_headline: Walking the Tightrope on Mental Health Coverage

docs.abstract: Ron Lieber Your Money column holds that while many people in United States with health insurance also have mental health coverage, some are reluctant to use it, or have trouble finding a practitioner who will accept it.
